title: Update Admin Panel Authentication to Use Custom Credentials

requirements.summary: Update AdminPanelPage authentication to use new credentials (admin/habibur123)
acceptanceCriteria: The admin login form on the /admin-panel page accepts username 'admin' and password 'habibur123'
The previous credentials 'admin'/'admin123' no longer work
Successful login with the new credentials grants access to the user management interface
Failed login attempts display an appropriate error message
The authenticated session persists in sessionStorage as before

file_operations.description: Update the hardcoded admin credentials from 'admin'/'admin123' to 'admin'/'habibur123' in the handleLogin function's credential verification logic. Replace the existing username and password constants or comparison values with the new credentials while maintaining the same sessionStorage-based session management and UserListTable integration.

requirements.summary: Ensure secure credential handling without plain-text exposure in logs or debugging tools
acceptanceCriteria: Admin credentials are not logged to the browser console
The credential verification logic is contained within the AdminPanelPage component
The implementation maintains the existing sessionStorage-based session persistence
The login form includes basic client-side validation for empty fields

file_operations.description: Review and remove any console.log statements that might expose admin credentials. Add basic client-side validation for empty username and password fields before credential verification. Ensure the credential comparison logic does not log or expose the expected credentials through debugging tools while maintaining the simple client-side authentication approach.

requirements.summary: Verify the updated admin authentication flow functions correctly
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /admin-panel displays the login form
Entering 'admin' and 'habibur123' successfully authenticates and shows the user management interface
The UserListTable component displays all registered users with their current status
Clicking 'Approve' on a pending user successfully updates their status to 'Approved'
The admin session persists across page navigation within the /admin-panel route

file_operations.description: Ensure the login form renders correctly on page load when not authenticated, the UserListTable component is displayed after successful authentication with the new credentials, and the sessionStorage-based session persistence works correctly for maintaining the authenticated state across page reloads and navigation.
